medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient II.8 initially presented symptoms of episodic headaches, truncal sweating, palpitations, and pallor at age 12. At age 25, he developed hypertension and was found to have a left-sided abdominal mass leading to surgery. At age 42, symptoms reoccurred with lower back pain and new episodes of headaches, sweating, and palpitations. Patient II.4 experienced symptoms including headaches and palpitations at age 45 and was diagnosed with an extraadrenal PGL at age 52.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient II.4 had a history of a duodenal ulcer at age 20. Patient II.8 and II.4 both had episodes of catecholamine-secreting tumor symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: The mother presented similar symptoms consistent with catecholamine-secreting tumor at age 55 and died at age 67 of bleeding duodenal ulcers. The maternal aunt had a history of a benign adrenal PCC.
